text.0: aŚvins your ancient priest invites you hither to gladden you with draughts of meath of soma.
text.1: our gift is on the grass our song apportioned with food and strength come hither o nāsatyas.
text.2: that car of yours swifter than thought o aśvins which drawn by brave steeds cometh to the people.
text.3: whereon ye seek the dwelling of the piouscome ye thereon to our abode o heroes.
text.4: ye freed sage atri whom the five tribes honoured from the strait pit ye heroes with his people.
text.5: baffling the guiles of the malignant dasyu repelling them ye mighty in succession.
text.6: rebha the sage ye mighty heroes aśvins whom like a horse vile men had sunk in water.
text.7: him wounded with your wondrous power ye rescued your exploits of old time endure for ever.
text.8: ye brought forth vandana ye wonderworkers for triumph like fair gold that hath been buried.
text.9: like one who slumbered in destructions bosom or like the sun when dwelling in the darkness.
text.10: kakṣīvān pajras son must laud that exploit of yours nāsatyas heroes ye who wander.
text.11: when from the hoof of your strong horse ye showered a hundred jars of honey for the people.
text.12: to kṛṣṇas son to viśvaka who praised you o heroes ye restored his son viṣṇāpū.
text.13: to ghoṣā living in her fathers dwelling stricken in years ye gave a husband aśvins.
text.14: ruṣatī of the mighty people aśvins ye gave to Śyāva of the line of kaṇva.
text.15: this deed of yours ye strong ones should be published that ye gave glory to the son of nṛṣad.
text.16: o aśvins wearing many forms at pleasure on pedu ye bestowed a fleetfoot courser.
text.17: strong winner of a thousand spoils resistless the serpent slayer glorious triumphant.
text.18: these glorious things are yours ye bounteous givers prayer praise in both worlds are your habitation.
text.19: o aśvins when the sons of pajra call you send strength with nourishment to him who knoweth.
text.20: hymned with the reverence of a son o aśvins ye swift ones giving booty to the singer.
text.21: glorified by agastya with devotion established viśpalā again nāsatyas.
text.22: ye sons of heaven ye mighty whither went ye sought ye for his fair praise the home of kāvya.
text.23: when like a pitcher full of gold o aśvins on the tenth day ye lifted up the buried.
text.24: ye with the aid of your great powers o aśvins restored to youth the ancient man cyavāna.
text.25: the daughter of the sun with all her glory o ye nāsatyas chose your car to bear her.
text.26: ye everyouthful ones again remembered tugra according to your ancient manner.
text.27: with horses brown of hue that flew with swift wings ye brought back bhujyu from the sea of billows.
text.28: the son of tugra had invoked you aśvins borne on he went uninjured through the ocean.
text.29: ye with your chariot swift as thought wellharnessed carried him off o mighty ones to safety.
text.30: the quail had invocated you o aśvins when from the wolfs devouring jaws ye freed her.
text.31: with conquering car ye cleft the mountains ridges the offspring of viśvāc ye killed with poison.
text.32: he whom for furnishing a hundred wethers to the shewolf his wicked father blinded.
text.33: to him Ṛjrāśva gave ye eyes o aśvins light to the blind ye sent for perfect vision.
text.34: to bring the blind man joy thus cried the shewolf o aśvins o ye mighty ones o heroes.
text.35: for me Ṛjrāśva like a youthful lover hath cut piecemeal one and a hundred wethers.
text.36: great and wealgiving is your aid o aśvins ye objects of all thought made whole the cripple.
text.37: purandhi also for this cause invoked you and ye o mighty came to her with succours.
text.38: ye wonderworkers filled with milk for Śayu the milkless cow emaciated barren.
text.39: and by your powers the child of purumitra ye brought to vimada to be his consort.
text.40: ploughing and sowing barley o ye aśvins milking out food for men ye wonderworkers.
text.41: blasting away the dasyu with your trumpet ye gave farspreading light unto the Ārya.
text.42: ye brought the horses head aśvins and gave it unto dadhyac the offspring of atharvan.
text.43: true he revealed to you o wonderworkers sweet soma tvaṣṭars secret as your girdle.
text.44: o sages evermore i crave your favour be gracious unto all my prayers o aśvins.
text.45: grant me nāsatyas riches in abundance wealth famous and accompanied with children.
text.46: with liberal bounty to the weaklings consorts ye heroes gave a son hiraṇyahasta.
text.47: and Śyāva cut into three several pieces ye brought to life again o bounteous aśvins.
text.48: these your heroic exploits o ye aśvins done in the days of old have men related.
text.49: may we addressing prayer to you ye mighty speak with brave sons about us to the synod.
